snippet: Two operators of pirate radio in New York were arrested, but weak enforcement by the Federal Communications Commission has encouraged renegade stations.
abstract: Pirate radio stations are responsible for Caribbean music that has infiltrated FM frequencies in New York City region for past decade; two operators of pirate radio stations have been arrested, but weak enforcement by the Federal Communications Commission has encouraged proliferation of such renegade stations; New York State has had most FCC enforcement activity of any state since 2003.
lead_paragraph: Two operators of pirate radio in New York were arrested, but weak enforcement by the Federal Communications Commission has encouraged renegade stations.

headline.main: Station Had Listeners, Just Not a License
headline.print_headline: Station Had Listeners, Just Not a License
